speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. A public place.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter CLOTEN and two Lords

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Sir, I would advise you to shift a shirt; the

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: violence of action hath made you reek as a

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: sacrifice: where air comes out, air comes in:

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: there's none abroad so wholesome as that you vent.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: If my shirt were bloody, then to shift it. Have I hurt him?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  No, 'faith; not so much as his patience.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Hurt him! his body's a passable carcass, if he be

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: not hurt: it is a thoroughfare for steel, if it be not hurt.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  His steel was in debt; it went o' the

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: backside the town.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The villain would not stand me.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  No; but he fled forward still, toward your face.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Stand you! You have land enough of your own: but

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: he added to your having; gave you some ground.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  As many inches as you have oceans. Puppies!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I would they had not come between us.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  So would I, till you had measured how long

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: a fool you were upon the ground.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And that she should love this fellow and refuse me!

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  If it be a sin to make a true election, she

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: is damned.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Sir, as I told you always, her beauty and her brain

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: go not together: she's a good sign, but I have seen

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: small reflection of her wit.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  She shines not upon fools, lest the

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: reflection should hurt her.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Come, I'll to my chamber. Would there had been some

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: hurt done!

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  I wish not so; unless it had been the fall

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: of an ass, which is no great hurt.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: You'll go with us?

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: I'll attend your lordship.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Nay, come, let's go together.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Well, my lord.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Exeunt
